result.execSummary:
The defendant Chester Anderson Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
The Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $2400.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, including $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge.
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs by the end of supervision period- any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

The Court ordered that all financial obligations and restitution be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.
The Court orders restitution in the stipulated amount of $1986.00 to Jeremy S.

The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  The defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program AFTER SERVING 12 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT.


Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with credit for 92 days served.

superMiscConds.notes: Firearms warning given. Voting admonishment given. DNA notification given.

No contact with known drug users or locations where illegal substances are trafficked or consumed.
No contact with Jeremy S.

Participate in Cognitive behavior therapy program and any other programming deemed appropriate by the department/agent.
If not previously done, provide a DNA sample-pay surcharge.

AODA assessment and complete follow-up care/treatment.
Absolute sobriety- no illegal drugs unless prescribed by physician.
Cooperate with random urine screens- no positive results.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 1 year.
Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chester Anderson Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to Black River Correctional Center W6898 E Staffon Rd Balack River Falls, WEI WI 54615

As to Count 1:  The Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining confinement to extended supervision.  Order forwarded to OS for processing.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 26 Judge  Pocan.
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: The motion/request to reduce the cost of installing and maintaining an ignition interlock device is granted, filed and signed by the Court.  The ignition interlock device shall be installed and maintained at 50% of the normal costs.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. jbs
Original Transcript (24 pages) SENTENCING HEARING, commencing AUGUST 11, 2015, received and filed.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Chester Anderson Smith not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing.  Court in trial.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chester Anderson Smith in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Chester Anderson Smith in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   Restitution will be determined at sentencing.  Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Chester Anderson Smith not in court, in custody.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests Projected guilty plea hearing.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont for Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Chester Anderson Smith not in court, in custody.  Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Griffin).  Court denied defense motion to modify bail.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Chester Anderson Smith in court with attorney Mary Guimont for Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Chester Anderson Smith in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM, drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Chester Anderson Smith in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Chester Anderson Smith in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
